p: With a predominantly tropical climate, Brazil is a country of high territorial dimensions, encompassing several biomes where the environment favors the development of some of the main arbovirus vectors and makes it a propitious place for the occurrence of arboviruses [ 8, 14]. In Brazil’s northern region, the Amazon joins abundant natural biodiversity, which also includes a big variety of arboviruses. Over 150 species of arboviruses have already been cataloged in this region, predominantly in the states of Pará and Amazonas [ 15].
